messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 18/09/2003 22:39:10 Pacific Daylight Time, Dnowens@aol.com ... Nancy, I had my son vacc. regularly as an infant,  up to 18mos. at which
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 18/09/2003 22:39:10 Pacific Daylight Time, Dnowens@...
writes:


> share some more on why you chose not to and why you did
> one child (or children) but not others. Thanks!
>

Nancy, I had my son vacc. regularly as an infant, up to 18mos. at which
point he was asthmatic, and became very ill, actually sick for 10 weeks with thet
famous "measle-like rash" and finally suffering actual mumps from the vacc. He
is now almost 8 and has not been done since. However he gets verys sick
frequently, not able to fight viruses etc., and after doing some reading, I
believe this is linked to being vaccinated. My daughter is 2, was never vacc'ed and
has had 3 colds in her life, that is it!!! She is happy, healthy and I
believe that is due in part to not being done. Both children were exclusiviely
breastfed, my son till 5.5 years old, my dd is still a nursing fiend. Just my own
experience.
Nancy in BC


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
